section.title: Installation
section.para: EiffelStudio, as well as EiffelMedia, come with an installer. Just follow the onscreen instructions like you would when installing any other program. No magic there..

Traffic does not need to be installed, just download the zip-file and unzip it to a directory of your choice. The applications such as Flat Hunt and City3D are located in the respective directory under traffic/example (e.g. traffic/example/flat_hunt). To get it to run, however, you'll have to compile it first.
For that you have to complete the following steps:

listitem.para: Open a shell. On windows you do this by going to Start ->Run... and typing "cmd".

Go to the directory of the application you want to compile, for example traffic/example/flat_hunt. On windows you can do this by typing for example "cd C:\MyProjects\traffic\example\flat_hunt" and pressing enter.

Type "geant install_develop" and press enter. This command will generate a file for you that is known as the ace-file. It is called developer.ace and you can find it in the folder where the application you want to compile is located. The generated ace-file contains all the needed data for compiling and running the application on your specific system.
Click on "File ->New Project...". Choose "Open existing Ace (control file)" from the dialog (see Figure 1) and click on "Next".
This will open a file dialog that lets you choose the Ace file. Browse to the directory where the application is located (e.g. traffic/example/flat_hunt).

Depending on your operating system and compiler choose one of the provided ace files: flathunt_xxx.ace ('flathunt_windows_bcb.ace' for Borland on Windows, 'flathunt_windows_msc.ace' for Microsoft Compiler on Windows, or 'flathunt_linux.ace' for Unix systems).

The dialog shown in Figure 2 lets you choose the project directory. In most cases you can leave both paths (Ace file and location) as EiffelStudio proposes. Make sure that the checkbox for compiling the generated project is selected. Click on "OK". This will start the compilation of the project.
Once the project is compiled you can execute it by clicking on the "Debug" button in EiffelStudio or by hitting F5.

para.emphasis: Now you have compiled your first application. Enjoy...
